## DerivAPI

**Extends DerivAPIBasic**

The main class of the DerivAPI module. This class extends the minimum
functionality provided by the [DerivAPIBasic][15] adding abstract objects
that can be used to read data and interact with the API.

### Parameters

-   `options` **[Object][88]** For options details see: [DerivAPIBasic][15]

### Examples

```javascript
// Returns an abstract ticks object
const ticks = api.ticks('R_100');

// Subscribe to updates on the ticks object
ticks.onUpdate().subscribe(console.log);

// Read the last ticks available in the default range
const ticksHistory = ticks.list;

// Read the last 100 ticks until yesterday
const olderHistory = await ticks.history({ count: 100, end: new Date(yesterday) });
```

### tickStream

Provides a ticks stream and a list of available ticks

#### Parameters

-   `options` **([String][89] \| [TicksParam][90])** symbol or a ticks parameter object

Returns **[TickStream][91]** 

### candleStream

Provides a list of available candles with the default granularity

#### Parameters

-   `options` **([String][89] \| [CandlesParam][92])** symbol or a candles parameter object

Returns **[CandleStream][93]** 

### contract

A contract object with latest status and ability to buy/sell

#### Parameters

-   `options` **[ContractsParam][94]** parameters defining the contract

Returns **[Contract][95]** 

### underlying

An underlying object, including contract groups, pip size, etc.

#### Parameters

-   `symbol` **[String][89]** The underlying symbol

Returns **[Underlying][96]** 

### account

An account object, including loginid, balance, contracts, etc.

#### Parameters

-   `token` **[String][89]** Token to create the account with

Returns **[Account][97]** 

### assets

Trading assets including multiple underlyings and trading times

Returns **[Assets][98]** 

## DerivAPIBasic

**Extends DerivAPICalls**

The minimum functionality provided by DerivAPI, provides direct calls to the
API.
`api.cache` is available if you want to use the cached data (see [Cache][25])

### Parameters

-   `options` **[Object][88]**  (optional, default `{}`)
    -   `options.connection` **[WebSocket][99]?** A ready to use connection
    -   `options.endpoint` **[String][89]** API server to connect to (optional, default `'blue.binaryws.com'`)
    -   `options.appId` **[Number][100]** Application ID of the API user (optional, default `1`)
    -   `options.lang` **[String][89]** Language of the API communication (optional, default `'EN'`)

### Examples

```javascript
const apiFromOpenConnection = new DerivAPI({ connection });
const apiFromEndpoint = new DerivAPI({ endpoint: 'ws.binaryws.com', appId: 1234 });
```

### subscribeWithCallback

Subscribe and call the given callback on each response

#### Parameters

-   `request` **[Object][88]** A request object acceptable by the API
-   `callback` **[Function][101]** A callback to call on every new response

#### Examples

```javascript
await api.subscribeWithCallback({ ticks: 'R_100' }, console.log)
```

Returns **[Promise][102]** Resolves to the first response or is rejected with an error

### subscribe

Subscribe to a given request, returns a stream of new responses,
Errors should be handled by the user of the stream

#### Parameters

-   `request` **[Object][88]** A request object acceptable by the API

#### Examples

```javascript
const ticks = api.subscribe({ ticks: 'R_100' });
ticks.subscribe(console.log) // Print every new tick
```

Returns **Observable** An RxJS Observable

### onClose

Reconnects to the API in case of connection error, unless connection is
passed as an argument, in that case reconnecting should be handled in the
API user side.

## Cache

**Extends DerivAPICalls**

Cache - An in-memory cache used to prevent sending redundant requests to the
API

### Parameters

-   `api` **[DerivAPI][103]** API instance to get data that is not cached

### Examples

```javascript
// Read the latest active symbols
const symbols = await api.activeSymbols();

// Read the data from cache if available
const cachedSymbols = await api.cache.activeSymbols();
```

## Underlying

**Extends Immutable**

Abstract class for an underlying

### Parameters

-   `api` **[DerivAPI][103]** 
-   `symbol` **[String][89]** 

### Examples

```javascript
const underlying = await api.underlying('R_100');

const pipSized = underlying.pipSizedValue(123.1);

// Same as api.tickStream(symbol);
const tickStream = underlying.tickStream();

if (underlying.isOpen) await contract.buy();
```

### pipSizedValue

Returns the pipSized display of the value in string

#### Parameters

-   `value`  

### tickStream

Shortcut for api.tickStream(symbol)

### candleStream

Shortcut for api.candleStream(symbol)

## Account

**Extends Immutable**

Abstract class for user accounts

### Parameters

-   `api` **[DerivAPI][103]** 
-   `token` **[String][89]** 

### Examples

```javascript
const account = await api.accounts(yourToken);

// Returns the open contracts of this account
const openContracts = account.openContracts();

const siblings = account.siblings;

// Switches the API account to the first sibling
siblings[0].switch();
```

### siblings

Returns **[Account][97]** all the sibling accounts

### openContracts

Returns **[Array][104]&lt;[Contract][95]>** A list of all open contracts

### closedContracts

Returns **[Array][104]&lt;[Contract][95]>** A list of all closed contracts

### switch

Switches to this account

## Immutable

An abstract class for immutable objects

### \_data

The main storage for the data in immutable objects

Any access should be done through getters and streams

## Assets

**Extends Immutable**

Abstract class for trading assets

### Parameters

-   `api` **[DerivAPI][103]** 

### Examples

```javascript
const assets = await api.assets();

// Get the current open markets
const openMarkets = assets.openMarkets;

const tradingTimes = assets.tradingTimes;
```

### openMarkets

Returns the current [Underlying][10] list for open markets

## CandlesParam

Type: [Object][88]

### Properties

-   `granularity` **[Number][100]** Granularity in seconds
-   `count` **[Number][100]** Number of candles returned by history
-   `symbol` **[String][89]** Symbol of the candles

## CandleStream

**Extends Stream**

An abstract class for Candles stream returned from [DerivAPI#candleStream][105]

### Parameters

-   `api` **[DerivAPI][103]** 
-   `options` **[CandlesParam][92]?** 

### list

An immutable list of Candle objects

#### Examples

```javascript
const candles = candleStream.list;
```

Returns **[Array][104]&lt;Candle>** 

### history

Resolves to a list of candles given the range

#### Parameters

-   `range` **[HistoryRange][106]?** 

#### Examples

```javascript
const oldCandles = await candleStream.history({count: 10, end: yesterday})
```

Returns **[Promise][102]&lt;[Array][104]&lt;Candle>>** 

## HistoryRange

Type: [Object][88]

### Properties

-   `start` **([Number][100] \| [Date][107])** An epoch in seconds or a Date object
-   `end` **([Number][100] \| [Date][107])**  An epoch in seconds or a Date object
-   `count` **[Number][100]** Number of ticks returned by history

## TicksParam

Type: [Object][88]

### Properties

-   `range` **[HistoryRange][106]** A chunk of history to return with start and end time
-   `symbol` **[String][89]** The ticks symbol

## TickStream

**Extends Stream**

Abstract class for ticks stream returned by the [DerivAPI#tickStream][108]

### Parameters

-   `api` **[DerivAPI][103]** 
-   `options` **[TicksParam][90]**  (optional, default `{}`)

### list

An immutable list of Tick objects

#### Examples

```javascript
const ticks = tickStream.list;
```

Returns **[Array][104]&lt;[Tick][109]>** 

### history

Resolves to a list of Ticks using the given range

#### Parameters

-   `range` **[HistoryRange][106]?** 

#### Examples

```javascript
const oldTicks = await tickStream.history({count: 10, end: yesterday})
```

Returns **[Promise][102]&lt;[Array][104]&lt;[Tick][109]>>** 

## Tick

Type: [Object][88]

### Properties

-   `time` **[CustomDate][110]** 
-   `quote` **[MarketValue][111]** 
-   `ask` **[MarketValue][111]** 
-   `bid` **[MarketValue][111]** 

## Tick

**Extends Immutable**

A wrapper class for Tick

### Parameters

-   `options` **[Object][88]** 
    -   `options.epoch` **([Number][100] \| [String][89])** 
    -   `options.quote` **[Number][100]** 
    -   `options.ask` **[Number][100]** 
    -   `options.bid` **[Number][100]** 
-   `pip` **[Number][100]** 

## CustomDate

**Extends Immutable**

An alternative date object

## MarketValue

**Extends Immutable**

Keeps a market value and pip size

### Parameters

-   `value`  
-   `pip`  

### pipSize

Returns the pip size

### pipSized

Returns the pipsized value

## ContractsParam

Type: [Object][88]

### Properties

-   `contractType` **[String][89]** 
-   `amount` **[Number][100]** 
-   `barrier` **[String][89]** 
-   `barrier2` **[String][89]** 
-   `dateExpiry` **([Number][100] \| [Date][107])** epoch in seconds or [Date][112]
-   `dateStart` **([Number][100] \| [Date][107])** epoch in seconds or [Date][112]
-   `Currency` **[String][89]?** Default is the account currency
-   `basis` **[String][89]** stake or payout
-   `duration` **([Number][100] \| [String][89])** duration with unit or duration in number
-   `durationUnit` **[String][89]?** duration unit, required if duration is number
-   `productType` **[String][89]?** 'multi_barrier' or 'basic'
-   `account` **[Account][97]?** The account that has this contract

## Contract

**Extends Stream**

Abstract class for contracts

### Parameters

-   `api` **[DerivAPI][103]** 
-   `options` **[ContractsParam][94]** 

### buy

Buys this contract

#### Parameters

-   `options` **BuyParam** 
    -   `options.maxPrice`  

Returns **Buy** 

### sell

Sells this contract

#### Parameters

-   `options` **SellParam** 
    -   `options.maxPrice`  

Returns **Sell** 

### isExpired

Returns **[Boolean][113]** 

### status

Returns **[String][89]** Current status of the contract

## Stream

**Extends Immutable**

An abstract class for stream objects
